result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnarius D. Haywood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: and successful completion of any follow through recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Darnarius D. Haywood in court with attorney Michael Yang.  Defendant Darnarius D. Haywood in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court heard counsel and received preliminary hearing waiver form.    Court heard counsel and received preliminary hearing waiver form.  Court addressed defendant.  Defendant wished to waive preliminary  hearing.  Court advised defendant of the charge and penalty.  Court conducts colloquy and knowingly and willingly waiver of preliminary hearing accepted.   Court binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.      Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.  Request to move into a PLEAS.
State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 2 - dismissed but read-in.  Ct 1 - NC plea.  W/H - 18 mo probation, cs to any other sentences - 25 hrs comm service, costs, AODA and any follow through recommendations, random UAs.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  NC plea given/entered.  Defendant sworn by the Clerk.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.  Warrant vacated.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
